name: Sebastian Siebertz
content: Homepage of Sebastian Siebertz Prof. Dr. Sebastian Siebertz HOME RESEARCH PUBLICATIONS ALGSTRUCT About me Since September 2019, I am a Professor at the University of Bremen. You can find my new webpage here. From October 2018 until August 2019, I was a postdoc in the research group of Prof. Dr. Stefan Kratsch at Humboldt-UniversitÃ¤t zu Berlin. From October 2016 until September 2018, I was a Marie SkÅodowska-Curie Fellow (supported by the National Science Centre of Poland and the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie SkÅodowska-Curie grant agreement No. 665778) at the Institute of Informatics, Faculty of Mathematics, Informatics and Mechanics of the University of Warsaw. I obtained my Ph.D. in September 2015 from Technische UniversitÃ¤t Berlin, supervised by Prof. Dr. Stephan Kreutzer. My research interests include parameterized complexity, (algorithmic) graph structure theory and applications of logic to computer science. More information can be found in my detailed CV (last update: November 2018).
